SEJDB

Class DBServices

  • java.lang.Object
    • SEJDB.DBServices

  • public class DBServices
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple framework for embedded java databases. Main focus is easy not complex storage of data.

    Conventions:

    - Every table has a fix ID (Integer) as primary key in the first column.

    - The ID handling is automatically

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBServices

        public DBServices(java.lang.String dbName,
                  java.lang.String login,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Constructor for a database without given default tables. Best use if the database already exists.
        Parameters:
        dbName - Name of the Database
        login - Account- Name for the Connection
        password - Login- Password for the Connection

      • DBServices

        public DBServices(java.lang.String dbName,
                  java.lang.String login,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  java.lang.String[] defaultTables)
        Constructor for a database without given default tables. Best use if the database doesn't exists already.
        Parameters:
        dbName - Name of the Database
        login - Account- Name for the Connection
        password - Login- Password for the connection
        defaultTables - Array of default tables to create if the database doesn't exist already

    • Method Detail

      • sql

        public void sql(java.lang.String sql)
        Perform a basic SQL statement without error correction! Can't show or print results.
        Parameters:
        sql - A SQL statement in string format.

        public void printTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                       int limit)
        Print the content of the given table to the console with a limit of rows to print.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table to print.
        limit - The limit of rows to print.

      • existsTable

        public boolean existsTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        Check if a table exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table to check.
        Returns:
        false if table don't exists in the Database; true if it exists.

      • deleteDatabase

        public void deleteDatabase()
        Delete the hole database and everything belong to it. Use with caution! No recovery!!!

      • insertData

        public void insertData(java.lang.String tableName,
                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> input)
        Insert one or more data for a single row in the table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Targeting table.
        input - HashMap containing the input data: <columnName, values>.

      • getFreeID

        public int getFreeID(java.lang.String tableName)
        Generate a new free ID to use. Always returns the lowers ID possible.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Targeting table.
        Returns:
        free ID

      • containsID

        public boolean containsID(java.lang.String tableName,
                          int ID)
        Check if the ID is already used in the table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Targeting table.
        ID - ID to check.
        Returns:
        true if the table contains the ID, false if not.

      • deleteRow

        public void deleteRow(java.lang.String tableName,
                      int ID)
        Delete a hole Row in the table identified by its ID.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Targeting table.
        ID - ID of the Row to delete.

      • getRow

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getRow(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                                   int ID)
        Search in the table for a single row by ID and return its data.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Targeting table.
        ID - row ID.
        Returns:
        single HashMap containing <ColumnNames, ColumnValue> as Strings for the found row.

      • getRows

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getRows(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                                                         java.lang.String columnName,
                                                                                         java.lang.String value)
        Search inside the table for rows with the "value" inside their "column".
        Parameters:
        tableName - Targeting table.
        columnName - Column name to search for.
        value - Column data to search for.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing HashMaps <ColumnNames, ColumnValue> as Strings for each found row.

        map - HashMap with Keys and Values as String.
